@graph.rdfs:comment: Adult Service such as massage or escort services
@graph.rdfs:label: AdultService

@graph.rdfs:comment: Represents an age group, such as young, old, child.
@graph.rdfs:label: AgeGroup

@graph.rdfs:comment: A string to refer to an entity.
@graph.rdfs:label: Appellation

@graph.rdfs:comment: Represents a cluster of objects
@graph.rdfs:label: Cluster

@graph.rdfs:comment: A document from a legal proceeding.
@graph.rdfs:label: CourtDocument

@graph.rdfs:comment: An email address.
@graph.rdfs:label: EmailAddress
@graph.skos:note: Still wavering whether an email address is a subclass of Identifier.

@graph.rdfs:comment: Represents Identity with or membership in a particular racial, national, or cultural group and observance of that group's customs, beliefs, and language.
@graph.rdfs:label: Ethnicity

@graph.rdfs:comment:
A group of people or things. Used to represent information about the
	group as a whole when the identities of the members are unknown.
@graph.rdfs:label: Group
@graph.skos:note: Use memex:size to specify the number of members in the group.

@graph.rdfs:comment: Identifier of an entity
@graph.rdfs:label: Identifier

@graph.rdfs:comment: The set of possible values for @container in JSON-LD
@graph.rdfs:label: JSONLD_ContainerValue

@graph.rdfs:comment: Uset to specify @container: @set.
@graph.rdfs:label: @Set

@graph.rdfs:comment: Represents a Legal Action
@graph.rdfs:label: LegalAction

@graph.rdfs:comment: The cause for a Legal Action
@graph.rdfs:label: LegalActionCause

@graph.rdfs:comment: Represents the Name of an entity.
@graph.rdfs:label: Name

@graph.rdfs:comment: A patent.
@graph.rdfs:label: Patent

@graph.rdfs:comment: The union of Person and Organization.

A phone number. The preferred representation of a phone number should have a name, and if possible a phoneCountryCode and a phoneNationalSignificantNumber. The name should have the format 'CCC NNNNNNNNNN' where CCC represents the country code and NNNNNNNNN represents the phoneNationalSignificantNumber without spaces. In the USA it is common to separate the area code from the subscriber number, but there is no standard convention that applies to all countries.
@graph.rdfs:label: PhoneNumber
@graph.skos:note:
Still wavering whether a phone number is a subclass of Identifier.
	Clearly not an appropriate identifier for a person given that numbers get recycled.

@graph.rdfs:comment: Represents a phrase. The contents appear in schema:name
@graph.rdfs:label: Phrase

@graph.rdfs:comment: A post in a forum.
@graph.rdfs:label: Post
@graph.skos:note: Equivalent to sioc:Post, a general class of post typically on the web, includes forum posts, blog posts, and tweets.

@graph.rdfs:comment:
Represents a preference that af Person or Organization may have
	about a certain subject.
@graph.rdfs:label: Preference

@graph.rdfs:comment: The attitude of a speaker or a writer with respect to some topic or the overall contextual polarity of a document. See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sentiment_analysis. Seniment analysis is a rich topic. This class defines an abstraction that should be specialized for different types of analyses and representaiton.
@graph.rdfs:label: Sentiment

@graph.rdfs:comment: Represents a software system, which can be an online system or a schema:SoftwareApplication.
@graph.rdfs:label: SoftwareSystem

@graph.rdfs:comment: A thread in a forum or other kind of set of articles
@graph.rdfs:label: Thread

@graph.rdfs:comment: The topic or theme of a Creative Work. See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Topic_and_comment. Topics should appear as values of schema:about. If there is a need to record probabilities or weights, these values should be stored in a Role object.
@graph.rdfs:label: Topic

@graph.rdfs:comment: A single Tweet.
@graph.rdfs:label: Post

@graph.rdfs:comment: Represents the user name or login name that a person uses to authenticate with a SoftwareSystem. UserName should appear as an identifier of a PersonOrOrganization. The hasType property should be used to specify the type of UserName, e.g., twitter. The softwareSystem property can be used to provide additional information about the software system associated with a UserName. The url property should be used to represent the login page, if relevant.
@graph.rdfs:label: UserName

@graph.rdfs:comment: Identifies the abstract of a CreativeWork. It is possible to represent the abstract as a CreativeWork, so it is possible to record other attributes such as word count.
@graph.rdfs:label: abstract

@graph.rdfs:comment: The entities affected by an event.
@graph.rdfs:label: affected

@graph.rdfs:comment: The age of a person.
@graph.rdfs:label: age
@graph.skos:note: The age of a person changes over time. When the time of observation is available, it is preferable to record the birthYear instead.

@graph.rdfs:comment: The number of elements in a set of things such as a Group. QuantitativeValue can specify a range, and the schema:unitCode for people is HEA, the standard code for heads of people. A Group can have multiple count values, to represent finer distinctions such as women, children, etc.
@graph.rdfs:label: count

@graph.rdfs:comment: Specifies the point in time when Role information was recorded. Use this property to create a time series of Roles that record multiple values of  a property changing over time.
@graph.rdfs:label: timestamp

@graph.rdfs:comment: Identifies a defendant in a LegalAction
@graph.rdfs:label: defendant

@graph.rdfs:comment: The ethnicity of a Person.
@graph.rdfs:label: ethnicity

@graph.rdfs:comment: eye color of a Person
@graph.rdfs:label: eyeColor

@graph.rdfs:comment: hair color of a Person
@graph.rdfs:label: hairColor

@graph.rdfs:comment: Identifies an ImageObject that is part of a schema:CreativeWork.
@graph.rdfs:label: hasImagePart

@graph.rdfs:comment: Identifies a post belonging to a memex:Thread.
@graph.rdfs:label: hasPost

@graph.rdfs:comment: The Type of an entity. Should be specified using a short string.
@graph.rdfs:label: hasType
@graph.skos:note: This property has a special meaning in DIG as the DIG processor: Given an array of objects, each with a hasType property, DIG will automatically convert it into a dictionary, generating a key for each value of hasType.

@graph.rdfs:comment: The Identifier of an entity. All memex:Identifier should have a memex:hasType property to specify the type of the identifier.
@graph.rdfs:label: identifier

@graph.rdfs:comment: Identifies the schema:CreativeWork that this abstract is a part of.
@graph.rdfs:label: isAbstractPartOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: The inverse of schema:author.
@graph.rdfs:label: isAuthorOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: Reverse citations.
@graph.rdfs:label: isCitationOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: Identifies a schema:CreativeWork that an image is a part of.
@graph.rdfs:label: isImagePartOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: Identifies the creative work that a post is a part of.
@graph.rdfs:label: isPostOf

@graph.rdfs:comment: Specify the JSON-LD @container directive.
@graph.rdfs:label: container

@graph.rdfs:comment: Records a LegalAction associated with some entity.
@graph.rdfs:label: legalAction

@graph.rdfs:comment: Identifies an operating permit for an organization.
@graph.rdfs:label: operatingPermit

@graph.rdfs:comment: owner of a thing
@graph.rdfs:label: owner

@graph.rdfs:comment: Specifies the area code of a phone number, see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Telephone_numbering_plan
@graph.rdfs:label: phoneAreaCode

@graph.rdfs:comment: Specifies the calling code of a country as defined in https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_country_calling_codes. Also see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Telephone_numbering_plan
@graph.rdfs:label: countryCallingCode

@graph.rdfs:comment: Specifies the number to dial after a contry code to identify a subscriber; this number consists of an area code followed by a subscriber number, see http://www.itu.int/dms_pub/itu-t/opb/sp/T-SP-E.164C-2011-PDF-E.pdf
@graph.rdfs:label: phoneSubscriberNumber

@graph.rdfs:comment: Specifies the calling of a subscriber, see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Telephone_numbering_plan
@graph.rdfs:label: phoneSubscriberNumber

@graph.rdfs:comment: Identifies a plaintiff in a LegalAction
@graph.rdfs:label: plaintiff

@graph.rdfs:comment: Represents the polarity value of a Sentiment. The scale is not prescribed, and its interpretation depends of the type of sentiment analysis being represented.
@graph.rdfs:label: polarityValue

@graph.rdfs:comment: The primary location associated with a schema:CreativeWork.
@graph.rdfs:label: primaryLocation

@graph.rdfs:comment: The Phrases in a PhraseScheme.
@graph.rdfs:label: sentiment

@graph.rdfs:comment: Identifies a signature block of a CreativeWork.
@graph.rdfs:label: signature

@graph.rdfs:comment: The sofware system assiciated with a UserName.
@graph.rdfs:label: softwareSystem

@graph.rdfs:comment: Define PersonOrOrganization as a super class of Organization.
Define PersonOrOrganization as a super class of Person.
